description: Cerasus serrulata (Japanese Cherry) x 6:T1: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round.T2: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round.FPS - remove 3-4 small diameter (no greater than 3cm) rubbing limbs betwen 3-4m to prevent future branch damage and allow more light through to adjacent building.T4: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round, and 4m clearance  east over awning.FPS - remove 5-6 damaged and crossing (no greater than 3cm diameter)  branches throughout central crown to avoid future damage and allow more light through to adjacent building.T5: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round.FPS - remove 7-8 damaged and crossing (no greater than 3cm diameter)  branches throughout central crown to avoid future damage and allow more light through to adjacent building.T6: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round.FPS - remove 5-6 damaged and crossing (no greater than 3cm diameter)  branches throughout central crown to avoid future damage and allow more light through to adjacent building.T7: LPD - lift lower branches (and lower parts of larger diameter branches) to provide 3m clearance above ground level all round.FPS - remove 4 damaged and crossing (no greater than 3cm diameter)  branches throughout lower central crown to avoid future damage.
